conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine the distance fallen.
The graph shows velocity over time; x-axis is time in seconds, y-axis is velocity in m/s.
Focus on the interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
Distance fallen is the area under the velocity-time graph from 0 to 10 seconds.
Velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s over the first 10 seconds, forming a trapezoid.
Formula for the area of a trapezoid: A = 1/2 * (b1 + b2) * h.
Substitute values: b1 = 0 m/s, b2 = 20 m/s, h = 10 seconds, A = 100 meters.
Area under the curve from 0 to 10 seconds is 100 square units, representing 100 meters.
Distance fallen is greater than 100 meters because the curve is above the straight line from (0,0) to (10,20).
